page.title: 18TRANSPORT TO SCHOOL
page.content: Because most people live quite far away, they travel to school in a mini-bus and a car.The dinners are cooked at Echt school and the car takes them to our school.In winter there are lots of storms.Last year the snow was eight feet deep.The school was closed for two weeks.All the roads were blocked and no-one could get out for food.The children from the farms have "storm-addresses" near the school in case they are unable to reach home.Food supplies are delivered for the winter, should anyone have to sleep in the school.When we reach the age of 11 or 12 we go to Alford Academy.It is fifteen miles away so we travel by private bus.
